front.title: (Dual Stack) Mobile IPv6 Implementation with unmodified IPsec

abstract.t: It's been argued in the past and in some documents, such as RFC 3776, RFC 4877 and RFC 5555, that an IPsec implementation needs to be modified to afford security services to MIPv6 and DSMIPv6. This document shows that it is possible to implement MIPv6 and DSMIPv6 in a way that does not require change to a native or Bump-in-the-stack (BITS) IPsec implementation conformant to RFC 4301.
